creditline: Princeton University, presented in 1893 to the American Whig Society by members of Whig in Class of 1892
inscribed:
Inscribed, in relief, around figure's head: JAMES MADISON / LITERAE . A / MICITI A . MO / RES;
Inscribed, in relief, below figure: PRESENTED BY THE CLASS OF 1892;
signed: Signed and dated, middle right: John Flanagan, Paris [with s reversed], April 1892

caption: John Flanagan (1865–1952; born Newark, NJ; died New York, NY; active Paris and New York), James Madison, Class of 1771 (1751-1836), 1892. Bronze. Princeton University, presented in 1893 to the American Whig Society by members of Whig in Class of 1892 (PP172)
